BEGIN .primary_content
The Impact of Your Support
The relationship between community and the local arts extends far beyond an acknowledgement in a newsletter.  When you partner with us, we experience a growth in community development where jobs are created, tourism is boosted, new businesses are born, and there is a revival of minds and energy coming together wanting nothing but the best for our fellow neighbors. Supporting the arts means supporting the financial and intellectual enhancement of your community.
2025 Exhibition & Program Sponsors
To learn about the benefits of becoming an annual sponsor, please email
smt@ormondartmuseum.org
!

BEGIN .primary_content
ISEA Innovations 2025
34th Annual International Open Juried Exhibition
September 17 – November 30, 2025
This juried exhibit features nearly 90 works — paintings, photography, sculptures, video, and assemblages — all of an experimental nature from artists across the globe.
Exhibit Opening Reception & Awards Ceremony
You're Invited!
Thursday, Sept. 18 | 5:30 - 8:00pm
Join us to celebrate the opening of this premier exhibition! Mingle with ISEA artists, hear artist talks, and enjoy light refreshments and music. A cash bar will be available for beer and wine. This FREE event is open to the public.
Art Innovation Symposium
ISEA Workshops at OMAM
Those who register for the symposium (Sept. 17-20) will have the opportunity to attend the amazing workshops listed below. Workshop tuition ranges from $150 to $345. Some prices may include materials fee, so please read the full course description on the ISEA website. Registration for all of the Innovations events/workshops are processed by ISEA. Learn more at
iseaartexhibit.org/Symposium2025
.
If you have questions, please email
symposium@iseaartexhibit.org
.
What is Creativity and How Do We Access It?
Two-Day Workshop with Fran Gardner
Wednesday & Thursday, Sept. 17-18 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Memory Ware Mosaics
Two-Day Workshop with Gila Rayberg
Wednesday & Thursday, Sept. 17-18 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Design Elements with Mixed Media
One-Day Workshop with Christine Peloquin
Thursday, Sept. 18 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Chinese Brush Painting
One-Day Workshop with Ann Kozeliski
Friday, Sept. 19 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Batik Techniques
One-Day Workshop with Muffy Clark Gill
Friday, Sept. 19 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Dyes with Native Plants
One-Day Workshop with Aida Tejada & Deborah Rosental
Friday, Sept. 19 | 10:30am - 3:30pm
Celebration Dinner
Friday, Sept. 19 | 6:00 - 9:00pm
Our final evening of the International Society of Experimental Artists Symposium will be one of celebration and entertainment, with a delicious meal and fellowship. What a spectacular way to celebrate a wonderful week of art making and camaraderie with all our artist friends and guests. Tickets are $65 each. Seats are limited. Register at
iseaartexhibit.org/Symposium2025
.
Past ISEA Best of Show – Max & Gracie Founders Award Winners:
2024
2024
Kendra Postma
Nestle
2024
Clay/wood, 30" x 9.5" x 2"
“Nestle” is experimental due to the abnormal use of clay. The pieces, or “shards,” are made from the leftover clay from my extruder. After each clay extrusion, the extruder tube is left to dry out until the next use. When I saw how thin and fragile the dried clay had become, I thought it would be a challenge to see how many pieces I could save without breaking them. I love how they stack inside each other and create dimension and structure, hence the name Nestle. The best part is when light shines onto the piece, creating all kinds of interesting shadows. Sometimes, when the light is shown onto it, they almost look like birds nestling together.
2023
2023
Christine Alfery
Your Mind Sings - Listen
2023
Acrylic on paper, 44" x 34" x 0"
The controlled mapping of the face, and the controlled brushwork within the mapping, were so different for me. I pride myself on never coloring within the lines. While I was frustrated with the lack of free spontaneous marking and form-making that I so enjoy when creating, I continued to fill in the spaces to see where the work would take me. Later when I returned to work, I immediately created the red-orange hair and was able to stand back and say "she is finished." I listened to the music the work was singing to me. At first, with the controlled mark-making it was like a controlled symphony slowly, slowly building and then a crescendo of the symphony happened with a burst of red-orange hair, making the work very experimental for me. In the end I enjoyed the statement the work made, it speaks of the contrast of robotic control, the machine, and the fluid flow of creativity.
2022
2022
Jean Pederson
Blink
2022
Mixed media, 30" x 30" x 2"
I’ve been integrating the ideas of time and movement from quantum mechanics into my practice. Transforming realism into distorted or shifting shapes offers my mixed media a new fresh approach.
"When you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change." — Max Planck
2021
2021
Dennis Salaty
The Dwelling
2021
Mixed media assemblage, acrylic and found objects, 12" x 12" x 3"
I usually work with acrylic, collage and assemblage. This piece was experimental for me because I used different materials to create an assemblage-type painting. I experimented using a canvas panel as a base to construct the piece. I also experimented by using new materials, such as the course pumice gel that covers the canvas, which I never used before.
About the ISEA
The International Society of Experimental Artists was founded in 1991 with the idea that artists working in an experimental manner need a society where they can share ideas and techniques - both old and new and encourage the development of new talents and skills. There is a need to connect, encourage, inform and promote artists who create art by experimentation and exploration. The Society offers members three opportunities a year to exhibit their work, with the annual INNOVATIONS/Symposium as an opportunity to exhibit in a public space. The International Society of Experimental Artists' mission is to enthusiastically embrace creative thinking, imagination and experimentation. We promote public interest in experimental art, and encourage and support artists' creative journeys through exhibition, education and communication. ISEA has had about 500 members In the USA and around the world.

Call for Artist Submissions
OPEN NOW!
Art Walk Pop-Up Solo Exhibitions
Emerging and established artists have the opportunity to exhibit their work at Ormond Memorial Art Museum as part of a curated three-day pop-up show held in conjunction with the
First Saturday Ormond Art Walk
.
Typically, artwork is displayed on easels in the Reception Gallery, and is setup the day before the Art Walk (preferably at 10am Friday) and remains up the day after the event (with pickup at 3:30pm that Sunday). The exhibiting artist should be present at the museum during the Art Walk (3-7pm). The artist may sell their work (commission-free), and there is no charge to participate. Interested artists should
complete this online form
. Please submit up to 10 pieces for consideration. OMAM will select up to 10 pieces. Please also write a thoughtful artist statement for the collection of work you are submitting, or write individual artist statements for each piece submitted, as this is a part of the selection process. Incomplete entries will not be reviewed.
Pop-Up submissions will be open March 1 - Sept. 20, 2025.
Submissions will be reviewed and artists will be notified of acceptance in September/October.
OPEN NOW!
Call for Teaching Artists
The Ormond Memorial Art Museum & Gardens collaborates with dedicated artists and educators to provide creative learning opportunities for the community. We’re excited to continue expanding our education programs, and invite instructors interested in teaching students age 16 & older to submit a proposal. All media will be considered, and classes may draw on any art-related, garden-related, or creative theme.
We are currently reviewing proposals for classes and workshops to be held in
January-June 2026
.
You will be contacted when your application is reviewed. Please submit your proposal here:
https://form.jotform.com/250235443731147
If you have questions, please Contact Kristin Heron at
KHeron@ormondartmuseum.org
.
CLOSED
1940s Art/Fashion/Music Exhibition
Submission Deadline:
August 15, 2025
The
OMAM Guild
is hosting a fundraiser with a 1940s theme, and is seeking items to showcase the fashion, art and music of the era. Submissions of period fashions and accessories for both women and men to be displayed in OMAM's Reception Gallery and as well as in a live fashion show. We are also seeking pieces of 1940s art, including pieces referencing the style and substance of WWII. Funds raised will support the mission of the museum to inspire our community through art and nature while honoring those who fought for freedom. Exhibition dates will be October 11 through November 16, 2025. "
Once Upon A Time: The 1940s
" will open on Saturday, Oct. 11, and will culminate with a live runway fashion show on Saturday, Nov. 15. Donors may elect to gift pieces to the museum to be included in the silent auction.
Both the exhibition and fashion show will be curated, not all submissions will be part of the event.
CLOSED
2024-2026 Exhibitions at OMAM
Artists seeking to exhibit their work in the main galleries of the Ormond Memorial Art Museum are encouraged to
apply to this open call
.
Application Process
Submission Deadline:
March 31, 2024
Exhibition at the Ormond Memorial Art Museum is open to any artist or collaborative of artists submitting original works of art or design created within the past three years. Professionals in all disciplines are encouraged to submit. Artists will be notified electronically of receipt of materials. The OMAM exhibition selection committee meets annually to select artists for future shows. Artists will be notified by email upon selection by committee in mid-late 2024.
No email entries will be reviewed. Entries must be submitted through
CaFÉ
.
Important Links:
Click
HERE
to read all application requirements including eligibility criteria.
You must have a CaFÉ account to apply. Click
HERE
to create your free account, or click
HERE
to sign into your existing account.

In Memoriam
B. Thomas Brown, MD
1948-2024
Dr. Brown was an active member of OMAM's Board of Directors from 2011 to 2024. He served as treasurer from 2012 to 2014, vice president from 2014-2015, and president from 2016 to 2018.
Dr. Brown attended Johns Hopkins University, West Virginia University, University of Miami, and the University of South Florida. He was appointed a Diplomat of the American Board of Urology in 1980 and practiced in Daytona Beach from 1978-2014. He led a distinguished career in administrative medicine and Urology.
He was extremely active in his community outside of medicine. He also was appointed to the Board of Directors for the Daytona Beach Rotary Club. He was a member of First United Methodist Church, Civic League of the Halifax Area, and also served on the Board of Directors for the University Club and Tiger Bay of Volusia County.
He loved fine art, good food, and the West Virginia Mountaineers. No matter the venue, he was the consummate networker you could often find him socializing at the Halifax River Yacht Club, having been a member there since 1987. When not traveling to visit his grandchildren, he loved traveling the world, and passed away July 14, 2024 on his last international trip with Al cruising through Greece and Turkey. Some of his proudest moments were giving gifts to his loved ones that he had handpicked on his far-away journeys.
Dr. Brown is survived by his daughter, Elizabeth Timbrook Brown, MD, MPH and her husband, David Hulan Hastings, and their two children Lucas Skelton Hastings (5), and Whitney Elizabeth Hastings (2); and his son James Schuyler Brown, Esq. and his wife, Amelia Pearson Brown, and their two children James Dean Brown (2) and Harper James Brown (7 months). He is also survived by Kimberlee Timbrook Brown, MD, his former wife of 32 years, and his current long-term partner of over 10 years, Edward Alton Adams.
In memory of their art-loving father, Brook and Schuyler Brown request, in lieu of flowers, that donations be made in their father’s honor to the
Ormond Memorial Art Museum
.
A memorial service will be held at 3:00 p.m. Friday, Aug. 2, 2024 at Haigh-Black Funeral Home, 167 Vining Court, Ormond Beach. His family will receive friends beginning at 2 p.m., immediately prior. To read Dr. Brown's full obituary, please click
HERE
.

BEGIN .primary_content
Worldwide Day of Play
Saturday, Sept. 27, 2025 | 10:00am - 4:00pm
Come experience joyful discovery through play at this FREE event in our Granada Pavilion Courtyard. This outdoor, dedicated early-learning space is stocked with interactive items. Visitors will be able to build using colorful stacking blocks, create a masterpiece at one of the mini art stations, grab a book and leaf cushion and find a shady spot to read, and make music with drums, xylophones, and other instruments.
Day of Play is part of a global initiative launched by Nickelodeon and the Association of Children's Museums to get kids OUTSIDE to play.
Admission is FREE!
Christmas in July
Saturday, July 19, 2025 | 10:00am - 4:00pm
The Ormond Memorial Art Museum is celebrating Christmas in July!
Join us in our gift shop between 10am and 4pm on Saturday, July 19, to get special discounts and to purchase a one-of-a-kind fused glass ornament handmade by members of the
OMAM Guild
.
Admission is FREE!
Inside the museum
, be sure to also check out our amazing
summer art exhibition
in the main galleries and search the first floor for our hidden elf to participate in the scavenger hunt!
This special event at OMAM is held in conjunction with the 8th Annual Christmas in July festivities organized by
Ormond Mainstreet
.
Santa's Schedule
Don’t miss your opportunity to snap a photo with Santa in his summer finest!

Elf Scavenger Hunt
Join official Christmas in July Elf Scavenger Hunt for a chance to win prices and gift certificates from area businesses!
Starting on July 12th
, search for hidden elves in participating locations (see list below!)
Collect at least six different store initials on the passport map.
For a bonus entry you must make ONE purchase of any value from any of the listed stops (bring receipts with you when turning in your scavenger hunt).
Drop off your completed map at the Ormond Main Street office (44A W Granada Blvd) before 4:00pm on July 21st.
Drawing will be held by Ormond MainStreet at 10:00am on July 25th!
Other Participating Locations

HERE
to visit the official Christmas in July event page on Facebook.

OMAM Membership
The Ormond Memorial Art Museum is a true community resource. We are able to thrive because of the hard work of volunteers and generous support of people from every corner of our community.
Membership is the cornerstone for continuing the tradition of art exhibitions, education and enrichment programs at our special community museum.
Click
HERE
to join!
Click
HERE
to login and renew your membership!
Click
HERE
to reset or create your membership account login!
Click
HERE
to buy a
gift membership
for someone else!
Digital Membership Cards
As of June 1, 2025, OMAM members are able to access their membership cards digitally from their phones, giving FAST and easy access to their amazing benefits. This environmentally-friendly option saves both time and money, as the download information is emailed
immediately
after the membership payment is processed!
If you need help accessing your digital card, please
click here
for instructions with step-by-step images, or visit the museum's front desk for assistance. You can also reply to your membership confirmation email with any questions or concerns (
or send a new email to agreen@ormondartmuseum.org
). Paper membership cards will now only be printed/mailed upon request.
PLEASE NOTE:
Only only one digital card is issued per account. For accounts with two named adults, the card may only display the primary account holder’s name in some circumstances.
Benefits for ALL Members:
• Invitations to special events and opening receptions
• Subscription to monthly e-newsletter
• 10% discount at Museum store (on purchases over $10)
• Discounts on OMAM art classes and workshops for children and adults
• Reciprocal privileges at more than
380
gardens in the American Horticultural Society (AHS)

The
American Horticultural Society
(AHS) offers special admission privileges and discounts to
380+
gardens throughout North American. Click
here
to view the AHS's Reciprocal Admissions Program Map to find a participating garden.
The
North American Reciprocal Museum
(NARM) Association® offers reciprocal membership benefits and discounts to
1,400+
participating arts, historical and cultural intuitions throughout North America. Click
here
to view the NARM Association member map.
Please note that benefits are specific to each institution. Be sure to contact the institutions you plan to visit in advance if you have questions about your specific reciprocal benefits.

Ormond Memorial Art Museum is a U.S. tax-exempt 501 (c) (3) organization. Contributions are deductible to the extent allowed by law.
Memberships are considered a donation, and are not refundable.
A COPY OF THE OFFICIAL REGISTRATION AND FINANCIAL INFORMATION MAY BE OBTAINED FROM THE DIVISION OF CONSUMER SERVICES BY CALLING TOLL-FREE, WITHIN THE STATE, 1-800-435-7352 (800-HELP-FLA), OR VISITING www.FloridaConsumerHelp.com. REGISTRATION DOES NOT IMPLY ENDORSEMENT, APPROVAL, OR RECOMMENDATION BY THE STATE. Florida Registration # CH7333.
